reviewText:
What I played so far its a really interesting game. I would consider it a puzzle platformer. You die after one hit, the clue is,  only hazards and enemies kill you. Jumping down a cliff or out of the windows results in the classic labyrinth experience as every border is connected to the level you are playing in. This means that if you go over the border at the right side you appear left, this works with falling, jumping and enemies.

It has a simple story about creation of life, you were made on the sixth day and got the task to collect all the colored crystals to return color to the world. Progress is achieved through buying the next level with your crystals, as you need every crystal to complete a level its a totally fair system. You just have to figure out how to get every crystal without dying as dying resets the level and what you gathered in it.

The music is something experimental, slightly reminding me of Corpse Part during a few parts. There is an option to turn the music off, if you dont like it. Upon death you hear a specific phrase that matches the story.

About the difficulty, I started at easy and will check out the other difficulty levels later. But so far its relaxing (on easy) and sometimes you have to think shortly to get every crystal.

I brought it because it looks interesting and I wanted to support the small developer.
For the asking price its a nice puzzle platformer which I for sure will complete. =)

EDIT: The other reviews mention how the game doesnt start. For me, I downloaded it and pressed the normal play button to start it. Had no problems with it. =)

reviewText: You go around through levels collecting gems, avoiding enemies, and teleporting from left to righ, top to bottom, etc. As you collect gems in each level, it completes an aspect in the background, such as lighting up a block or growing grass. Each level slightly progresses in difficulty, adding new mechanics or enemies that keeps the game interesting. Some textures aren't exactly clean cut, like the enemies and Anki, and the hit detection is a little silly.\n(Just play level 10 and you'll more than likely see what I mean.)\nBut the gameplay makes up for these minor technical issues. Overall, if you enjoy platformers, I would recommend this. Anki is an enjoyable title at a pretty affordable price.

reviewText:
I was supplied with this key by the developer, this however did not affect the review. All my developer sponsored reviews are positive because I review games that I like!
═══════════════════════════════════
OVERVIEW
ANKI

This is platformer that has non-euclidean rules. In this game falling does not lead to death... unless you land on a trap. The screen wraps left-right and up-down. This is the main mechanic in this platformer. There are numerous puzzles, mostly in the form of determining the path you take to collect all the crystals. Collecting these crystals is the main objective in each level, and you will only be able to proceed once all have been collected. The level ends when the last crystal is obtained, and this is where it becomes rather puzzle-like in route development. There are interesting mechanics that keep the levels fresh, some of which are unique to which world" you are in. The pixel art and color palette are appealing. The only real complaint would be the hitboxes are slightly larger than one would anticipate on some traps.

http://store.steampowered.com/app/395380/

═══════════════════════════════════
PROS & CONS
Pros
Platforming that makes use of fun mechanics
Some of the songs in the soundtrack are great
Simple controls
Mechanics of the gameplay are simple enough to need no tutorial
Hard enough to be fun without being unfair
Cons
Hitbox can sometimes fool you
═══════════════════════════════════
SUMMARY & FINAL RATING
This game is $1 USD or whatever your national equivalent might be. If platformers are not your thing or you are easily frustrated
date:
this game might not be for you. The number of levels combined with not encountering any bugs makes this game well worth that dollar. Fun platformer with a pleasant soundtrack.

7/10
═══════════════════════════════════

reviewText: A great little platformer where you have to negotiate your way through each screen by falling off the bottom just to appear at the top of the screen and walking off the left to appear at the right! This may sound simplistic but the old grey matter gets a bit strained as you start to think now
date: how do I get to tha area?". It's colourful and jolly sounding so if you enjoy a platformer with a slight edge then this is for you."

reviewText:
PL:
Interesująca gra zręcznościowo logiczna. Może i grafika nie jest najwyższych lotów, za to grywalność stoi na dość wysokim poziomie. Generalnie w grze chodzi o to, żeb zebrać wszystkie kryształki z planszy. Czasami wymaga to kilku prób i powtarzania poziomu, ale nawet i ewentualne powtarzanie poziomu nie przeszkadza w grze. Muzyka jest dość przyjemna jak na tak prostą grę, nawet i pomaga w skupieniu.

Ogólnie to polecam tę grę. Jest to całkiem dobra gra polskiej produkcji, gdzie można się trochę zrelaksować. Wiadomo, nie jest to Wiedźmin 3, ale i też nie kosztuje 160zł a około 4zł. Moim zdaniem warto.

ENG:
An interesting little hybrid between a platformer and a logic game. You need to collect all of crystals on the stage, so sometimes you will need to repeat a stage because you've picked them up in a wrong order. This is really basic, yet kind of pleasant game.

For that price (1 Euro as per day of review) you can try it. It's not to special of course, it's not a AAA class game, but it still should be pleasant to play. The music is fairly good in this one too.
----------

reviewText:
Nice platformer for some casual fun with kind of retro-feeling which I like.
Sometimes a little tricky to avoid the monsters, since only one touch means you're dead, but with the right timing it is possible.
(Have not played on the difficult level yet, might get more tricky then.)
The other thing you have to do a little try and error is how to enter the different locations of a leve, since here falling does not mean dead, but being kind of transported to another location. So you have to find out where to fall in order to which location you want to go and in this course also pay attention how you fall down again, since this might be the one and only possibility to reach a certain crystal.
Really like it.
